title: Cyber Guidance Website (Frontend) with Auth UI, Scam Education, and Scam Reports

requirements.summary: Build multi-page navigation and user-facing sections: Home, Scam Guidance, What to do/How to help, and Scam Reports (submit + browse).
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation exists to access Home, Guidance, Help/Reporting, and Scam Reports sections.
All user-facing text is in English.
Scam Guidance includes at least: phishing, OTP/UPI fraud, fake customer care, card skimming, investment/crypto scams, job/loan scams, and social media impersonation.
Help/Reporting page includes step-by-step actions (e.g., secure accounts, preserve evidence, contact bank, report to relevant authorities) presented in a clear checklist format.

file_operations.description: Create the top-level app shell with client-side routing and a consistent layout (header/nav + main + footer) that wires routes for Home, Scam Guidance, Help/How to Help, Scam Reports, and Login/Register. Ensure no page is orphaned (all routes reachable from nav).
Add a reusable layout component used by all pages to enforce consistent spacing/typography and shared header/footer styling across the site.

Implement primary navigation UI with links to Home, Guidance, Help, Scam Reports, and Login/Register. Use shadcn-ui components for accessible navigation elements and responsive layout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create Home page content explaining the site purpose and safety boundaries (no OTP/PIN/credentials). Wire in the generated logo and hero illustration for the hero section (see asset wiring requirement notes).

Create Scam Guidance content with educational cards/sections for: phishing, OTP/UPI fraud, fake customer care, card skimming, investment/crypto scams, job/loan scams, and social media impersonation. Use shadcn-ui Card/Accordion components to keep content scannable. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the What to do / How to help page with clear step-by-step checklists for victims and helpers (account security, preserving evidence, contacting bank, reporting to official authorities). Use shadcn-ui Checkbox/List patterns for a clear checklist format. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create Scam Reports page container that composes report browsing, filtering, and (when signed in) submission UI; ensure it is accessible via navigation and routing.
Add the generated image asset file at this exact path and wire it into the UI (Home page header/brand area).
Add the generated image asset file at this exact path and wire it into the UI (Home page hero section).

requirements.summary: Implement Login/Register UI using platform-supported Internet Identity, maintain logged-in state, and gate scam report submission to signed-in users.
acceptanceCriteria: A Login/Register page exists and allows the user to sign in and sign out.
When signed out, the Scam Reports submission form is disabled/hidden and a clear prompt to log in is shown.
When signed in, the user can access the scam report submission form.

file_operations.description: Create a dedicated Login/Register page that uses the authorization component’s frontend identity flow (useInternetIdentity) to login/logout and display authenticated state. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a hook that uses the authorization component’s required profile functions (getCallerUserProfile/saveCallerUserProfile via the actor) to load/save the current user profile and avoid profile-setup flash per guidance. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement a first-login profile setup dialog (collect a display name only) backed by saveCallerUserProfile. Use shadcn-ui Dialog/Form components for accessible UX. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Gate the report submission area: when signed out, hide/disable the form and show a clear prompt linking to the Login/Register page; when signed in, render the submission form. Use the authorization component’s identity state (useInternetIdentity) to determine sign-in. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add login/logout affordance in the nav that uses the authorization component’s identity flow and clears cached app data on logout (via react-query queryClient.clear()) as required by the component guidance. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the AuthPage route into the router and ensure navigation includes access to it.

requirements.summary: Enable signed-in users to submit scam reports (type, title, description, approximate date, optional loss) and allow all users to browse reports with scam-type filtering and live list updates.
acceptanceCriteria: Submission validates required fields (scam type, title, description) and shows user-friendly errors.
After submitting a report, it appears in the list without a full page refresh.
Scam report list supports filtering by scam type.
Each report shows: scam type, title, date reported, and a short preview of description.

file_operations.description: Create React Query hooks for loading scam reports (all + filtered by type) and creating a report using the backend actor methods available in the typed interface. Ensure cache invalidation or optimistic update so new reports appear without a full page refresh.

Build the scam report submission form with required fields (scam type, title, description), approximate date input, and optional loss amount. Use shadcn-ui Form, Input, Select, Textarea components for accessible validation messaging. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement the report list UI showing scam type, title, date reported, and a short description preview. Use shadcn-ui Card/Badge components for readable list items. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a scam-type filter control (predefined categories) that updates the list query and supports clearing back to 'all'. Use shadcn-ui Select or Tabs for filtering UI. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Compose ScamTypeFilter + ScamReportList for all users and render ScamReportForm only when signed in (per REQ-2). Ensure post-submit updates list via query invalidation/optimistic update.
Add small frontend utilities to format backend timestamps (bigint) into a readable English date string and to format/guard optional loss amounts for display without exposing sensitive info.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive non-blue/non-purple visual theme across pages with consistent typography, spacing, and styled components (nav, cards, forms, lists) with accessible contrast and focus states.
acceptanceCriteria: All pages share consistent layout, typography, and component styling.
Theme uses a coherent palette that is not primarily blue/purple.
Forms, navigation, and lists are clearly readable and accessible (sufficient contrast, clear focus states).

file_operations.description: Define a distinctive warm/earthy theme (non-blue/non-purple) using Tailwind + CSS variables used by shadcn-ui tokens (background/foreground/primary/etc.), plus global typography/spacing defaults and clear focus-visible styles. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Adjust Tailwind theme extensions only as needed to support the new palette/typography scale (keeping existing shadcn-ui token approach intact).
Apply consistent container widths, spacing rhythm, and typography hierarchy (headings/body) so all pages feel unified.
Ensure navigation styling matches the new theme (colors, active states, focus states) and remains accessible/legible.

requirements.summary: Add a Resources section within Guidance or Help that lists evidence to collect, safe bank-contact guidance, and how to find official reporting channels without hardcoded country-specific numbers.
acceptanceCriteria: Resources content includes evidence checklist (screenshots, transaction IDs, chat logs, URLs, phone numbers) and safety reminders.
Copy avoids claiming to be official law enforcement and advises users to use official channels for their location.
No country-specific emergency/cybercrime numbers are included unless the user supplies them.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable Resources section component with an evidence checklist, safety reminders, and guidance to find official cybercrime reporting channels by region (no country-specific numbers). Use shadcn-ui Accordion/Card components for scannable structure. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Embed the ResourcesSection within the Help/How to Help page below the action checklists, ensuring content stays general and clearly non-official.
Optionally cross-link to the ResourcesSection/Help page from relevant scam guidance content to improve discoverability, without adding new top-level routes.
